data.chText: 指示；命令；吩咐
data.enText: to tell sb to do sth, especially in a formal or official way

data.chText: 那封信指示他立即向总部汇报。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: The letter instructed him to report to headquarters immediately.

data.chText: 飞机一准备好就会通知你去何处。
data.enText: You will be instructed where to go as soon as the plane is ready.

data.chText: 她依照指示于10点钟到达。
data.enText: She arrived at 10 o'clock as instructed .

data.chText: 他下令在城的周围筑一道城墙。
data.enText: He instructed that a wall be built around the city.

data.chText: 他下令在城的周围筑一道城墙。
data.enText: He instructed that a wall should be built around the city.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+直接引语

data.chText: 教授，传授（技能等）
data.enText: to teach sb sth, especially a practical skill

data.chText: 我们的员工都接受过手语训练。
data.enText: All our staff have been instructed in sign language.

data.chText: 告知；通知
data.enText: to give sb information about sth

data.chText: 我们已获悉周末前不会作出决定。
data.enText: We have been instructed that a decision will not be made before the end of the week.

data.chText: 委托（律师）；托办

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: to employ sb to represent you in a legal situation, especially as a lawyer

data.chText: 以上各词均含命令、指挥、要求之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to use your position of authority to say to sb that they must do sth.
order

data.chText: 指命令、指挥、要求：
data.enText: to use your position of authority to tell sb to do sth

data.chText: 公司被勒令向以前的员工作出补偿。
data.enText: The company was ordered to pay compensation to its former employee.

data.chText: “马上过来！”她命令道。
data.enText: ‘Come here at once!’ she ordered.
tell

data.chText: 指命令、指示、吩咐：
data.enText: to say to sb that they must or should do sth

data.chText: 有人吩咐他坐下等着。
data.enText: He was told to sit down and wait.

data.chText: 别对我指手画脚的！
data.enText: Don't tell me what to do!
instruct

data.chText: 尤指以正式或官方的方式指示、命令、吩咐：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to tell sb to do sth, especially in a formal or official way

data.chText: 那封信指示他立即向总部汇报。
data.enText: The letter instructed him to report to headquarters immediately.
direct

data.chText: 指正式发出指示、命令：
data.enText: ( formal ) to give an official order

data.chText: 法官指示陪审团作出无罪裁决。
data.enText: The judge directed the jury to return a verdict of not guilty.
command

data.chText: 指利用权力命令：
data.enText: to use your position of authority to tell sb to do sth

data.chText: 他命令手下撤退。
data.enText: He commanded his men to retreat.

data.chText: 用order还是command？
order较command通用，可用于任何权威人物命令他人做某事，如父母、老师或政府。command的语气稍强于order，可能暗指有人反对这命令，或如果允许的话，有人会反对。command是部队长官发布命令的一般用词，或者用于发布一般没有商量余地的命令。该词不大可能用于父母或老师。
data.enText: Order is a more general word than command and can be used about anyone in a position of authority, such as a parent, teacher or government telling sb to do sth. Command is slightly stronger than order and can suggest that there is some opposition to the order, or would be if opposition were allowed. It is the normal word to use about an army officer giving orders, or in any context where it is normal to give orders without any discussion about them. It is less likely to be used about a parent or teacher.
order or command?
to order/tell/instruct/direct/command sb to do sth
to order/tell/instruct/direct/command sb that…
to order/instruct/direct/command that…
to do sth as ordered/told/instructed/directed/commanded

simple_means.memory_skill: in 使… + struct 建造，建立 → 使〔知识〕建立 → 指导

tr: give instructions or directions for some task
example: She instructed the students to work on their pronunciation
He instructed me in building a boat
Have the students been apprised of the tuition hike?

value.def: If you instruct someone to do something, you formally tell them to do it.

example.ex: The family has instructed solicitors to sue Thomson for compensation...
example.tran: 那家人已经指示律师起诉汤姆森,要求赔偿。

example.ex: 'Go and have a word with her, Ken,' Webb instructed...
example.tran: “肯,去和她谈谈吧,”韦布吩咐道。

example.ex: I want you to instruct them that they've got three months to get the details sorted out.
example.tran: 我想让你告知他们,他们有3个月时间来解决细节问题。

value.def: Someone who instructs people in a subject or skill teaches it to them.

example.ex: He instructed family members in nursing techniques.

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to build 建造, 建立
rootsaffixes.title: struct

partsOfSpeech.dec: con 共同 + struct 建造，建立 → 共同建立 → 建筑
con 共同 + struct 建造，建立 + ion，construct 的名词 → 建设
de 相反 + stroy〔= struct〕建造，建立 → 不建反而破坏
de 相反 + struct 建造，建立 + ible …的 → 违反建筑规格的 → 易毁坏的
de 相反 + struct 建造，建立 + ion 表名词 → 不建造 → 毁灭
de 相反 + struct 建造，建立 + ive …的 → 有破坏力的
in 使… + struct 建造，建立 → 使〔知识〕建立 → 指导
instruct 指导，教导 + ion 表动作，intruct的名词 → 教导，指导
instruct 指导，教导 + or 表人 → 教师，讲师
ob 反 + struct 建造，建立 → 反着建造 → 妨碍
ob 反 + struct 建造，建立 + ion，obstruct 的名词 → 阻碍；闭塞
re 重新 + construct 构造，建筑 → 重建
struct 建造，建立 + ure 表结果 → 构造；结构
sub 下 + struct 建造，建立 + ion 表名词 → 建在下面的 → 基础
super 上 + struct 建造，建立 + ure 行为有关的物 → 建在上面的 → 上层建筑
